title: Patching the Wall: The Rise and Abandonment of Roman Manchester
description: In 197 AD, emergency detachments of Noricans and Raetians were shipped from Austria to rebuild Mamucium's gate after a civil war left Britain exposed. It wasn't imperial confidence — it was damage control at the edge of empire. Within fifty years the civilian settlement was dead. Within a hundred and fifty, the garrison was gone. Manchester didn't make the cut.
